results.content: Explains very well. I feel like he is actually talking to me personally.
results.content_html: Explains very well. I feel like he is actually talking to me personally.

results.content: I thought this course was okay. Eddie seems like a nice instructor, and he is very engaging and fun to listen to. While I learned some of the basics of CSS and HTML, and these are all certainly more understandable now, I was expecting more practical outcomes: such as class projects and dealing  with actual wordpress templates, and how to style these in different ways. I felt Eddie focused way too much on the various ins and outs of CSS, instead of applying it in everyday situations. To make this course better, I would focus on styling a basic website from start to finish, using nice CSS that people would actually use.
results.content_html: I thought this course was okay. Eddie seems like a nice instructor, and he is very engaging and fun to listen to. While I learned some of the basics of CSS and HTML, and these are all certainly more understandable now, I was expecting more practical outcomes: such as class projects and dealing with actual wordpress templates, and how to style these in different ways. I felt Eddie focused way too much on the various ins and outs of CSS, instead of applying it in everyday situations. To make this course better, I would focus on styling a basic website from start to finish, using nice CSS that people would actually use.

results.content:
This guy is an excellent instructor!! :) The course is really really great for CSS beginners if you have at least the basic knowledge of HTML. 

A BIG plus: after this course, I was able to jump into like any CSS code and not just find my way around it, but I was also confident to tweak the code and make the changes I (and my clients) want, and all of that pretty quickly and with no fuss or mess.

I'd just add this: whatever you hear and wherever, please AVOID using the "!important" in your code - it's a really bad practice and with every use of it, you're 1 step closer to making your code hard to troubleshoot later! On the other hand, using "!important" is totally ok when you're just beginner and need it to see if something will work. But really, please use it if you really, really must and if there's no other way to override another code.

Overall, this was a fabulous learning experience! Eddie Makes is an amazing instructor, you can just 'see' that he cares about his students' learning process and he explains important stuff very carefully. With this course, you'll get a 'real world' knowledge and experience that you can start using right away and will give you a good foundation for further learning and gaining an expertise in CSS.

Thank you, Eddie!

Thank you, Eddie!

results.content:
I loved this course.  Eddie is great.  He explains and demonstrates in a way that I'm comfortable and I understand.   With other instructors I've sometimes gotten lost and couldn't follow what they were doing. 
 I'm going to seek out his other courses, something I've never done with an instructor before.

He made the course fun, engaging and relaxed.  I'm surprised how much I learned and how comfortable I now feel coding CSS.

results.content:
I've taken a few courses on CSS, and I have to say, this course is special, the instructor (Eddie) does a fantastic job of explaining not only the how but the why we are being asked to do a task. 

The step by step "real world" approach for styling a very popular plugin put this all in perspective for me. I'm hoping the instructor continues to evolve this course to include some examples of other popular (and stubborn) plugins like bbPress and BuddyPress, GeoDirectory Plugin that behaves oddly on every theme I've tried to use it on :) , etc. 

The content and teaching style is exactly how visual learning is supposed to be in my opinion. Looking forward to more.
results.content_html:
